issues.title: Uses ARIA roles on incompatible elements
issues.description: Many HTML elements can only be assigned certain ARIA roles. Using ARIA roles where they are not allowed can interfere with the accessibility of the web page. [Learn more about ARIA roles](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-allowed-role).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  ARIA role img is not allowed for given element

issues.title: Elements must meet minimum color contrast ratio thresholds
issues.description: Ensure the contrast between foreground and background colors meets WCAG 2 AA minimum contrast ratio thresholds

any.message: Element has insufficient color contrast of 2.77 (foreground color: #ffffff, background color: #4caf50, font size: 10.0pt (13.3333px), font weight: normal). Expected contrast ratio of 4.5:1

issues.title: Background and foreground colors do not have a sufficient contrast ratio.
issues.description: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. [Learn how to provide sufficient color contrast](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/color-contrast).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Element has insufficient color contrast of 2.77 (foreground color: #ffffff, background color: #4caf50, font size: 10.0pt (13.3333px), font weight: normal). Expected contrast ratio of 4.5:1

issues.title: <html> element must have a lang attribute
issues.description: Ensure every HTML document has a lang attribute

any.message: The <html> element does not have a lang attribute

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  The <html> element does not have a lang attribute

issues.title: The html element should have a lang or xml:lang attribute which describes the language of the document.
issues.description:
<html><head>
<title>Webpage Recreatio...</html>

original_issue.message: The html element should have a lang or xml:lang attribute which describes the language of the document.

issues.title: `<html>` element does not have a `[lang]` attribute
issues.description: If a page doesn't specify a `lang` attribute, a screen reader assumes that the page is in the default language that the user chose when setting up the screen reader. If the page isn't actually in the default language, then the screen reader might not announce the page's text correctly. [Learn more about the `lang` attribute](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/html-has-lang).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  The <html> element does not have a lang attribute

issues.title: This textinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
issues.description: <input type="text" style="width: 300px; border: 1px solid #C6CBD4; padding: 5px;">

original_issue.message: This textinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
original_issue.selector: html > body > div > div:nth-child(4) > table > tbody > tr > td:nth-child(2) > input:nth-child(4)

issues.title: Form elements do not have associated labels
issues.description: Labels ensure that form controls are announced properly by assistive technologies, like screen readers. [Learn more about form element labels](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/label).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Element does not have an implicit (wrapped) <label>
  Element does not have an explicit <label>
  aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
  aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty
  Element has no title attribute
  Element has no placeholder attribute
  Element's default semantics were not overridden with role="none" or role="presentation"
